E. The disturbance is not attributable to the physiological effects of
a substance (e.g., medication or alcohol) or another medical
condition (e.g., mild traumatic brain injury) and is not better ex-
plained by brief psychotic disorder.
Adjustment Disorders
A. The development of emotional or behavioral symptoms in re-
sponse to an identifiable stressor(s) occurring within 3 months of
the onset of the stressor(s).
B. These symptoms or behaviors are clinically significant, as evi-
denced by one or both of the following:
1. Marked distress that is out of proportion to the severity or in-
tensity of the stressor, taking into account the external con-
text and the cultural factors that might influence symptom
severity and presentation.
